This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://open.spotify.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fopen.spotify.com%2F) ### Comment > Spotify player gets stuck on ads sometimes on web player with AdGuard enabled - no songs, nothing, not even ad plays. Only solution is to refresh the browser and replay the playlist. Trying to change playlist doesn't work either, completely stuck playerand now playing view. While with AdGuard disabled, ads load normally and player works as intended. One important thing: It happens after 2-3 times ads are skipped. e.g I open player, play a playlist, ads come normally due course, gets skipped twice or even thrice, songs playing uninterrupted, after that it gets stuck on ad and nothing plays. Like spotify detects adblocker is on after 2-3 skips and blocks plays (guess). ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/83mi74u948w0g4kgws88k0sg8g8k4sg9pssix2rkdg.png?nc=1)

issue.title: www.chumplady.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.chumplady.com/other-woman-asks-chump-lady-to-inform-the-wife-about-an-affair/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chumplady.com%2Fother-woman-asks-chump-lady-to-inform-the-wife-about-an-affair%2F) ### Comment > The chumplady.com website loads noticeably slower than other websites and ads have been “leaking” through. At first it was just ads on a pop up lower banner, but then ads started appearing in the body of the post as well. There are also blank spaces and large light grey boxes in between the text, which I presume are the spots where ads would go. Other websites I frequent don’t have that and the look is much more seamless. ### Screenshots

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
[NSFW] [https://transadvice.org](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftransadvice.org)
### Comment
> I am one of the Community Stewards at https://transadvice.org - Your DNS server is reporting to our users that our peers support network serving the transgender community is a "phishing or malicious website"
> 
> Please properly classify our website. Thank you.

### [NSFW] Screenshots
  [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/pv5phl17f6ogo8ckkgc0ccwccsc04wo67skt0dqqns.png?nc=1)

Information | Value
--- | ---

comment.body:
TransAdvice.org has been a peer support site since 2010, serving the community providing a safe and non-judgmental space online.

It is unclear how we are classified as "phishing or malicious" - Our community is worried that this could happen to other LGBTQIA+ websites as well.

Please let us know if you have any questions at all!

Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://open.spotify.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fopen.spotify.com%2F) ### Comment > Spotify player gets stuck on ads sometimes on web player with AdGuard enabled - no songs, nothing, not even ad plays. Only solution is to refresh the browser and replay the playlist. Trying to change playlist doesn't work either, completely stuck playerand now playing view. While with AdGuard disabled, ads load normally and player works as intended. One important thing: It happens after 2-3 times ads are skipped. e.g I open player, play a playlist, ads come normally due course, gets skipped twice or even thrice, songs playing uninterrupted, after that it gets stuck on ad and nothing plays. Like spotify detects adblocker is on after 2-3 skips and blocks plays (guess). ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/83mi74u948w0g4kgws88k0sg8g8k4sg9pssix2rkdg.png?nc=1)

comment.body:
The same on my end (I don't see that ad), but I see a different ads only when app is not filtered.

By the way, in the case of Spotify app installed directly from Spotify website, it might be necessary to add it to filtered apps in AdGuard settings.
AdGuard -> Settings -> Network ->List of filtered applications -> Add Spotify
